subject: Law
title: Magna Carta: Limiting Royal Power
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Magna Carta: Limiting Royal Power.

hook.text: In 1215, English barons forced their king to sign a document limiting his power. The king hated it.

buildup.text: The Magna Carta established that even the king was subject to lawâ€”a radical idea at the time.

discovery.text: Key principles: no taxation without consent, no imprisonment without legal judgment, and access to justice.

twist.text: King John annulled it within weeks. But it was reissued repeatedly and became foundational English law.

climax.text: Its influence extends to the US Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

punchline.text: One document taught the world: no one is above the law.

quiz.question: What fundamental principle did the Magna Carta establish?
options: Even the king is subject to the law
